sentences.cn: 商人常口授信稿令人笔录.

sentences.en: Don't dictate to me to do that.
Don't try to dictate to children; they will obey you better if you ask them politely.
sentences.cn: 不要对孩子们发号施令,你如果礼貌地要求他们, 他们会更听话的.

sentences.en: Economics may dictate only a one - time treatment.
sentences.cn: 在经济上可能只限于一次治疗.

sentences.en: Fashion gurus dictate crazy ideas such as squeezing oversized bodies into tight trousers.
sentences.cn: 时装大师们常表达一些离奇的想法，诸如让身材肥胖的人穿上紧身裤。

sentences.en: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.cn: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.en: He can't write but he can dictate.
He cannot be allowed to dictate what can and cannot be inspected.
sentences.cn: 什么能检查，什么不能检查不能由他说了算。

sentences.en: He cannot write but he can dictate.
How fast do you dictate to your secretary?
sentences.cn: 你向你的秘书口述的速度有多快?

sentences.en: No one is going to dictate to me where to live!
sentences.cn: 谁也不能命令我非住哪儿不可!

sentences.en: Of course, a number of factors will dictate how long an apple tree can survive.
sentences.cn: 当然，影响一棵苹果树寿命的因素有很多。

sentences.en: She’s dictating a letter to her secretary right now.
sentences.cn: 她现在正在给秘书口授一封信。

sentences.en: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
That is what our obligations to the workers and peasants of the USSR dictate to us.
sentences.cn: 我们对苏联的工人和农民的义务要求我们必须这么做.

sentences.en: The rules of court dictate that a defendant is entitled to all evidence which may help his case.
sentences.cn: 法庭规定被告可以出示任何对其辩护有帮助的证据。

sentences.en: The union leaders are trying to dictate their demands to the employer.
sentences.cn: 工会领导人正设法迫使雇主接受他们的要求.

sentences.en: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.cn: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.en: You should be able to dictate the terms of the agreement to the firm which you are buying.
sentences.cn: 你应该使你要买下的公司接受协议的条款.

trans.tran_en: an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey
to say words for someone else to write down
to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave

trans.tran_cn: 口述，命令，指示，使听写，控制，支配

trans.tran_en: to say words for someone else to write down
